threads.title: 820-01700 - quick CD3217 boot loop, sometimes a slower boot loop in lower ports.
threads.message:
820-01700 presented with no obvious damage.  Customer says wouldn't wake from sleep one day.  This is the board with the "left side SSD controller corrosion problem", so I looked there first and found the smallest of evidence of the usual corrosion *beginning* to occur.  I saw just a little bit of tin dust.  I didn't reball it yet but the SSD readings seemed normal to me, diode mode too.

The first issue is that it's [B]boot looping immediately on the "A" upper ports [/B](TA, XA), [B]but boot looping differently: after negotiating 20V @ .06A briefly on the lower "B" ports[/B]. 

This happens usually.  There is a "sometimes" event as well where everything is working fine (after something discharges overfnight? ). When "sometimes" happens, it pulls charging current, charges the battery, PPBUS goes full and everything is hunky dory. Screen lights up and all that.  This happens for about a minute, then the charger is reset and we're back to square one. 

The second issue (likely related) is that port XA (U3100) refuses to power on my ammeter at all, or keeps it reset when the machine's battery / battery data cable is connected.  I replaced the CD3217 there to identical symptoms. Diode mode and resistance on all LDOs seem normal, CLK too.  Did the beep test on all major anything I could see, nothing out of the ordinary. I think the battery is fine?  I have that sweet Romanian battery tester, I should use it.

Any suggestions here? PMU inductor inspection? ILS9240? Replace every CD3217?  The one I replaced is from another 01700, same positioning.

threads.title: 820-01700 - quick CD3217 boot loop, sometimes a slower boot loop in lower ports.
threads.message:
You should check and compare diode mode readings on both USB-C connectors.
S-UEM2 tool is very helpful in this case.
Possibly problems with CC1/2 lines on the port which keeps ampmeter black.
Also inspect USB-C terminals; remove them from the case.

Disconnect internal LCD and check if machine stays on with external monitor; test HDMI output on various ports.

Does it still restart in recovery/boot menu?
Did you test in safe mode?
